WizardAnswered on 07 Mar 2019I feel that the biggest mistake, along with not understanding what you're investing in is being too emotional and panicky when making decisions. This can lead you to situations where you blindly follow others or to make decisions without thinking enough. Another potential pitfall I feel is being too greedy initially and just wanting to make as much returns as possible, without thinking through a potential strategy or staying invested for the long term. Not sure if this can be considered the biggest mistake, but I feel that not sticking to an investment or a portfolio strategy can also be an issue, and merely flipping around with your portfolio strategies. I feel that being consistent is much better here!0 comments0
